Articles.Content:
![6Pc85c1.png](http://i.imgur.com/6Pc85c1.png)

I have spent a week and a half or so working through the US's X-planes (x-15, x-35, etc)

[**Wiki List\_of X-planes**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_X-planes)

Most of them can be reasonably modeled in Kerbal and after doing so I found each has it's own characteristics and quirks.

I tried to match the real life missions on most of them. 

The X-4 is undercontrolled, the X-12 explodes when you stage, the X-17 suffers from spaghetti, the X-32 is underpowered, and the X-24B is unflyable but many of these problems aren't too far from reality. each has a description with a wiki blurb about it's importance etc. and any special controls.

My personal favorites are the X-13, the X-15, X-27 and X-35

the X-35 is a modified F-35 by mareczex333 and the B-52 is slightly modded from allmhuran's design. Other than that, they are all entirely original. ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

I skipped the few I was unable to build stock ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif) maybe some other time.

[Craft files](https://www.dropbox.com/s/179dd93ooqozz1k/X-planes.zip?dl=0)

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/yREDCDvTcMs?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

![DctNiwJ.png](http://i.imgur.com/DctNiwJ.png)

There are rare times I feel compelled to push the rep button more than once...this is one of those times. That B-52 picture dropping the X-15 is glorious ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

Wow, great job. You must of had some serious time on your hands. I have made the X-3, X-29, and a X-15 (with a bomber) in my *Kerbal Imitations* series (Link in my signature), but you really did well with a large number of craft. It looks like I used the same method as you (Wikipedia!) for information. I had to Rep you for this.
